intro: Pleurothallis jalapensis, commonly known as the Jalapeño orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to Central America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and yellow. The plant prefers shaded, humid environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Its roots are fibrous and adapted to absorb moisture from the forest floor. Despite its modest appearance, it plays a significant role in the ecological balance of its habitat.
